N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1024.3 - Explosives-radioactive materials

State Regulations

Except as otherwise set forth in section
1024.6
of this Part, no vehicle
shall enter upon the Triborough Bridge, Bronx-Whitestone Bridge, Throgs Neck

Bridge, Henry Hudson Bridge, Marine Parkway Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge, Cross

Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge or the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge Upper Level, if
its load includes: (a) any class A or B
explosives, as defined by U.S.D.O.T. regulations, except special
fireworks--including railway or track torpedoes--in quantities not in excess of
10 pounds gross weight per vehicle; or
(b) any highway route controlled-quantity
radioactive materials as defined by U.S.D.O.T. regulations, except when: (1)
a facility set forth hereinabove is a
component of a preferred route selected in accordance with U.S.D.O.T. regulations and of a written route plan prepared in compliance with such
regulations. The driver of a vehicle carrying such materials shall produce a
copy of such written route plan to the facility supervisor for examination
prior to entry upon the facility; (2)
the shipment complies with all packaging, labeling, placarding, quantity limitations and other applicable requirements of
the U.S.D.O.T. regulations and the regulations of the Nuclear Regulatory

Commission; (3)
the driver of such
shipment has in his possession a certificate of training, certifying compliance
with the training requirements of the U.S.D.O.T. regulations. Such certificate
shall be provided to the facility supervisor for examination prior to entering
upon the facility; (4)
if the
shipment includes irradiated reactor fuel, the shipper provides physical
protection as required by U.S.D.O.T. regulations and the regulations of the

Nuclear Regulatory Commission; and
(5)
the carrier has proof of financial
responsibility in the amounts required by Federal regulations. (c) any other radioactive material
for which placarding is required by the U.S.D.O.T. regulations except when: (1)
a facility set forth hereinabove is a
component of a route selected by the carrier to minimize radiological risk in
accordance with the U.S.D.O.T. regulations, taking into account accident rates, transit time, population density and activities, time of day and day of week
during which transportation will occur; (2)
the shipment complies with all packaging, labeling, placarding, quantity limitations and other applicable U.S.D.O.T. requirements; and
(3)
the carrier
has proof of financial responsibility in the amounts required by Federal
regulations. Notes
